meanings.definition: The quality or state of being bimodal.
meanings.sent1: The bimodality of the data showed two clear peaks.
meanings.sent2: Researchers observed the bimodality in the distribution of test scores.
meanings.sent3: The bimodality of the weather forecast confused the meteorologists.
meanings.sent4: The bimodality of opinions on the topic created a divide in the community.
meanings.sent5: The bimodality of the landscape made it visually striking.

meanings.definition: The presence of two distinct modes or peaks in a distribution.
meanings.sent1: The bimodality of the graph indicated two different trends.
meanings.sent2: Statisticians analyzed the bimodality in the income distribution.
meanings.sent3: The bimodality of the traffic pattern surprised the city planners.
meanings.sent4: The bimodality of customer preferences influenced the marketing strategy.
meanings.sent5: The bimodality of the music genre appealed to diverse audiences.
